alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 7:54PM AKST until December 23 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THURSDAY TO 6 PM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Visibility reduced to 1/2 mile or less. Northeast winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From 6 PM Thursday to 6 PM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions due to reduced visibility in blowing snow. Snow drifts onto roads may produce hazardous travel conditions. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds are expected to peak around 9PM Thursday night and continue until 3PM Friday afternoon. Winds will then slowly diminish Friday evening into Saturday.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
